thread.title: Moto G5 images leaked ahead of MWC 2017 launch : News, News - India Today
thread.title_full: Moto G5 images leaked ahead of MWC 2017 launch : News, News - India Today

author: Shobhit Varma
title: Moto G5 images leaked ahead of MWC 2017 launch : News, News - India Today
text:
Last Updated: FEB 22, 2017 New Delhi Email Author 
Leaks and rumors regarding the Moto G5 have been gathering steam as of late and now new images of Motorola's upcoming budget smartphone have emerged online. 
The hands-on photos point towards the device having a slightly smaller 5-inch 1080p display as compared to its elder brother, the Moto G5 Plus which is set to come with a 5.2-inch 1080p display. The source of the leaked images claims that the Moto G5 will come with a metal back as well as a removable battery. 
Additionally, earlier rumors indicate that the Moto G5 will come with a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 processor, 32GB of internal storage which can be expanded via a microSD card, 2GB of RAM and Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box. What about the Moto G5 Plus? 
The Moto G5 Plus has also been leaked multiple times ahead of its launch. 
A few days ago, a Google + user in Brazil had uncovered an image of the Moto G5 Plus with a marketing sticker attached over the display. The sticker pointed towards the device having a 5.2-inch 1080p display, a 3,000mAh battery with TurboPower quick charging support, , a 12MP 'rapid focus' rear camera, NFC as well as a fingerprint scanner. Additionally, Previous rumors indicate that the smartphone will come with the the Snapdragon 625 processor and Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box. 
A press render of the Moto G5 Plus that was leaked online a few weeks ago also points towards major design changes in tow. The G5 Plus is expected to come with a home button up front (The G4 Plus had capacitive keys) , a new silver color variant and a circular camera panel. Price and availability Both the Moto G5 Plus and Moto G5 are expected to be announced on February 26 at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona and are expected to carry a price tag of $200 (Approximately Rs 13,400) and $250 (Approximately Rs 16,800) respectively. 
We do expect the Indian prices to be lower than these however keeping in mind that the Moto G4 Plus was launched at Rs 13,499 and the Moto G4 at Rs 12,499. 
Also Read: Moto G5 and G5 Plus listed on retail site, full specs and images leaked For more news from India Today, follow us on Twitter @IndiaTodayTech and on Facebook at facebook.com/indiatodaytech For news and videos in Hindi, go to AajTak.in .ताज़ातरीन ख़बरों और वीडियो के लिए आजतक.इन पर आएं.
